name: Hellometer
headline: Making fast food faster
description:
Hellometer helps fast food owners' grow same store sales using security cameras to improve customer wait times.

Speed of service is fast food's core value proposition (it’s literally in the name) and owners currently don't have a reliable way to measure it. We show them when and where they have slowdowns and for every 7s they improve service times, owners see 1% increase in revenue.
generated_description:
Hellometer is a startup founded in 2020 and hailing from Los Angeles, California. This small but ambitious company, part of Y Combinator's Summer 2020 batch, is on a clear mission: to make fast food even faster. They tackle a significant pain point in the industry—wait times.

The core idea is straightforward: speed of service is what defines fast food. Yet, owners often lack solid methods to measure and improve it. Hellometer steps in with a solution that harnesses the power of security cameras. By analyzing footage, they pinpoint when and where slowdowns happen in the service process. They have found that every 7 seconds shaved off wait times translates to a 1% increase in revenues. For some fast food chains, that could mean a whopping $30,000 boost annually.

Their offerings include innovative tools such as the Drive-Thru Timer and Dining Room Timer. These tools allow restaurants to gauge guest experiences accurately—from the moment they arrive to when they receive their food. With cutting-edge AI and computer vision technology, Hellometer not only helps in improving efficiency but also enhances customer satisfaction.

The team may be small—only 2 employees—but they have a clear focus and a well-defined market. They tap into the burgeoning B2B SaaS and computer vision sectors, making their mark by providing a service that is surprisingly easy to implement. Just put up a camera, and the data starts flowing.

To get a clearer picture of how they work, take a look at their website: [Hellometer](https://hellometer.io/). Here, they emphasize that their technology can lead to faster wait times—averaging a reduction of 47 seconds—and a smoother overall operation for quick-service restaurants.

In a nutshell, Hellometer is transforming how fast food restaurants operate, turning wait times from a mystery into a measurable metric that can drive profits. It’s about making the drive-thru convenient and the dining experience smooth, all while keeping an eye on the bottom line.
